content: this legal text summarizes a court case in ljubljana slovenia the case identified as p 17032012 – ii lasted for three years and ended with a judgment on december 7 2015 the plaintiff who remains unnamed claimed ownership of half of an apartment building while the defendants who are the plaintiffs sons and exspouse claimed ownership of the other half the court decided that both parties would have equal ownership of the building the decision was based on the marriage family relations act and certain sections of the civil procedure code the court also allowed the plaintiff to amend their shares and declared that their coowned property consisted of a oneandahalfbedroom apartment on the 9th floor the defendants were ordered to pay the plaintiff a sum of 28000 eur along with interest within 15 days the plaintiffs application for the declaration of the purchase price of another apartment was dismissed the defendants were also ordered to pay the plaintiffs legal costs amounting to 281785 eur within 15 days the court found evidence that the plaintiff and the deceased defendant had lived together as a married couple until 2005 and made joint decisions such as purchasing apartments the court concluded that the property acquired during their cohabitation was coowned the defendants were required to reimburse the plaintiff for all legal costs incurred the text also explains the process of appealing a decision stating that the appellant has 15 days to lodge an appeal with the court providing copies of the appeal and stating the grounds for the appeal the appeal must be clear and may be dismissed if it is not the court fee must be paid when lodging the appeal and a power of attorney can be submitted by the attorney acting on behalf of the party
